title: Boy with Down's syndrome soils himself and has PTSD 'after abuse by school aide'
text:
Hudson Peterson, 10, reportedly became non-verbal, started soiling himself and required diapers after being abused by sadistic teaching aide Debbie Woodward, his parents claim (Pictures: KTLA)

A child with Down’s syndrome lost the ability to talk, began soiling himself and was diagnosed with PTSD after a school aide allegedly abused him.

Hudson Peterson, 10, had been progressing well and achieving all expected milestones until he arrived in Debbie Woodward’s class in 2016, aged seven.

The youngster’s parents Shannon and Scott Petersen say Woodward would lift Hudson by his wrists, scream at him, slap him and hit him, leaving the youngster with cuts and bruises.

Hudson was so badly traumatized by the alleged abuse at Tony Tobin Elementary School in Temecula, California,his educational development regressed.

He began suffering mood swings, had to start wearing diapers again and is now receiving therapy for post-traumatic stress disorder.

His distraught mother Shannon Peterson told KTLA that Woodward ‘destroyed’ Hudson after the youngster did not listen when asked to go back to his desk.

Shannon said: ‘She picked up him by his wrist, she yelled in his face, she dragged him across the room.

‘At one point she had picked him up by his wrists and kicked him across the room with her knees.

‘She put him in his chair and was yelling at him with her finger in his face.’

Shannon shared photos of the cuts and bruises she claims Woodward inflicted on her son.

She says the abuse was flagged up by a therapist who witnessed it, and made a legal statement attesting to what she had seen.

Shannon says an investigation found Woodward had abused Hudson, but says school bosses allowed her to resign, rather than terminate her contract.

That means Woodward can continue to work with children at the same school.

She and husband Scott have filed a lawsuit against the school, with jury selection set to begin Friday.

A school spokesman refused to comment, citing the pending litigation.
description: Hudson Peterson's parents say the youngster suffered a dramatic regression after being abused by teacher's aide Debbie Woodward
